section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to engage children with a song, build math background, and introduce vocabulary (drill, near).
Begin Story Time by introducing the book and asking, What happens during a fire drill?
Read for meaning and enjoyment, pausing to practice using location words.
Check understanding and differentiate as needed.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Spatial Sense: Use position words such as “over,” “under,” “above,” “on,” “beside,” “next to,” “between,” “in front of,” “near,” and “far,”* “top,” “bottom,” “up,” “down,” and “behind.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Identify own body within surroundings and respects others’ personal space.
Engage in movement sequences with adult prompts.
Understand and use varied types of words.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Review activity cards with children and identify the classroom objects in them.
Guide children to discuss the relative locations of other objects in the picture.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_essential-question: How can we protect ourselves and our bodies?

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: What book did you choose? What is this book about?
Can you pretend to be a firefighter? What is something you will do?
Can you explain what you’re doing using location words?
Can you write about staying safe?
What are you making? What colors are you using?
What letter did you hear at the beginning of safe? Can you make that letter?
What are you building? What materials will you use to build it?

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to share the Mind Builder, move carefully, and introduce vocabulary (carefully, beside).
Begin Story Time by connecting the Mind Builder to Fire Drill .
Read closely to talk about moving carefully in a fire drill and to review spatial sense.
Offer an extended play opportunity.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Spatial Sense: Use position words such as “over,” “under,” “above,” “on,” “beside,” “next to,” “between,” “in front of,” “near,” and “far,”* “top,” “bottom,” “up,” “down,” and “behind.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Identify own body within surroundings and respects others’ personal space.
Engage in movement sequences with adult prompts; Use perception to guide movement through space and interactions with objects and people.
Understand and use varied types of words.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use location words to instruct children in careful actions and bodily awareness.
Have children follow instructions to perform actions carefully and normally.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_essential-question: How can we protect ourselves and our bodies?

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: Why did you choose that book?
Can you pretend you are in a bubble? Show me how you would walk around, carefully not bumping anything.
How are you arranging objects? Why are they in that order?
Can you write about something that is important to do carefully?
Why did you put that on top? What will you draw next?
What sounds do you hear in the word carefully?
Can you build something next to what you built?

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to show children how information can be represented graphically, and introduce vocabulary (count, pairs).
Begin Story Time by revisiting Fire Drill and asking the guiding question, How do we keep track of all the children during a fire drill?
Read interactively to learn more details about how to stay safe during a fire drill.
Check understanding and differentiate as needed.
Share the daily writing option.

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Spatial Sense: Use position words such as “over,” “under,” “above,” “on,” “beside,” “next to,” “between,” “in front of,” “near,” and “far,”* “top,” “bottom,” “up,” “down,” and “behind.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Identify own body within surroundings and respects others’ personal space.
Understand and use varied types of words.
Use technology, including learning applications, to express own ideas.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Mark out a chart on the table to use as a graph.
Guide children to sort Cubes and Buttons into two columns on the table to create a graph.
Help children understand the graph.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_essential-question: How can we protect ourselves and our bodies?

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: What was your favorite part of the story? Why did you enjoy that part?
How can you pretend to be a teacher in charge of a fire drill?
How can you sort these items?
Why should we learn about fire safety?
Draw a picture of our class during a fire drill.
What sound do you hear at the beginning of the word drill?
How could you sort the materials you are building with?

tg_materials-caption.tg_materials-caption_book-title-Ital: Big Chart of Big Ideas: Five Little Froggies Jumping on the Bed

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to talk about being safe, making graphs, and introduce vocabulary words (jumping, little).
Begin Story Time by connecting the texts Five Little Froggies Jumping on the Bed and Fire Drill .
Read interactively to connect to being safe and overall health.
Offer an extended play activity.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Spatial Sense: Use position words such as “over,” “under,” “above,” “on,” “beside,” “next to,” “between,” “in front of,” “near,” and “far,”* “top,” “bottom,” “up,” “down,” and “behind.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.
Identify own body within surroundings and respects others’ personal space.
Recognize good habits of nutrition and exercise.
Understand and use varied types of words.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Build Connecting Cube setups behind a curtain.
Describe the arrangements to children using location words and have them recreate the setups.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_essential-question: How can we protect ourselves and our bodies?

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: What did that book make you think about?
How can you pretend to do something carefully?
Can you sort those items by color or size?
When have you learned a lesson on how to be safe?
Can you draw something next to what you already drew?
Can you look around the room and find something that starts with the sound /tr/?
How can you make your structure taller safely?

section-block.tg_copyright-line: TM ® & © Scholastic Inc. All rights reserved. Fire Drill by Paul DuBois Jacobs and Jennifer Swender, illustrated by Huy Voun Lee. section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to connect the book to healthy habits, practice spatial sense, and introduce a vocabulary word (between).
Begin Story Time by revisiting the book and asking, How do fire drills help us stay safe and sound?
Read and retell interactively for physical engagement and a focus on safety
Check understanding, differentiating as needed.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Spatial Sense: Use position words such as “over,” “under,” “above,” “on,” “beside,” “next to,” “between,” “in front of,” “near,” and “far,”* “top,” “bottom,” “up,” “down,” and “behind.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.
Identify own body within surroundings and respects others’ personal space.
Engage in movement sequences with adult prompts; Use perception to guide movement through space and interactions with objects and people.
Recognize good habits of nutrition and exercise.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Support children as they independently respond to this week’s prompt: Fire drills keep us safe at school. What do you do to stay safe at home?
Offer children an opportunity to use digital tools.
Save children’s writing to display next week.

section-block.tg_essential-question: How can we protect ourselves and our bodies?

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: What kind of book would you like to read next?
Pretend you are in charge of a safety drill. What do you do?
Can you sort the materials and see which there are more of?
Write a story that tells about a way to stay healthy.
What can you make that shows information the way a graph does?
What is your last name? What letter does it start with?
What can you build on top of what you are building? What can you put it between?

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Spatial Sense: Demonstrate use of location words (such as “over,” “under,” “above,” “on,” “beside,” “next to,” “between,” “in front of,” “near,” “far,” etc.). (TX.V.C.3)

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Are aware of where own bodies are in space and respect personal boundaries.
Coordinate sequence of movements to perform tasks.
Child uses a large speaking vocabulary, adding several new words daily.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Spatial Sense: Demonstrate use of location words (such as “over,” “under,” “above,” “on,” “beside,” “next to,” “between,” “in front of,” “near,” “far,” etc.). (TX.V.C.3)

Coordinate sequence of movements to perform tasks.
Use a large speaking vocabulary, adding several new words daily.

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect data and organize it in a graphic representation.
Are aware of where own bodies are in space and respect personal boundaries.
Use a large speaking vocabulary, adding several new words daily.
Use digital learning applications and programs to create digital products and express own ideas.
